abstract: Terrence M Cunningham, president of International Assn of Chiefs of Police, issues apology to minorities for past mistreatment by police during speech at annual conference in San Diego; Cunningham's remarks are unusual and symbolic step toward addressing lack of trust between law enforcement and predominantly black and Hispanic communities.

keywords.value: International Assn of Chiefs of Police
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The apology represented an unusual yet symbolic step by law enforcement, which has often dismissed any role in the tense relationship with members of minority groups.
snippet: The apology represented an unusual yet symbolic step by law enforcement, which has often dismissed any role in the tense relationship with members of minority groups....

headline.main: Official Apologizes for Police Role in Mistrust by Minorities
headline.print_headline: Rare Apology From Police to Minorities for the Past
